fields.description:
Bamboo with external user management enables this changes information in Crowd in an unacceptable way.

Bamboo profiles of crowd principals lack the jabber account information. After we update a bamboo profile the e-mail adres from the profile and full name are no longer visible. Switching to crowd I found out that the email adres is even removed from crowd!

fields.description:
The Maven 2 Clover plugin has some issues with multi module builds

http://jira.codehaus.org/browse/MCLOVER-34
http://jira.codehaus.org/browse/MNG-2184

It would be nice if the Clover Coverage in Bamboo could support seperate Clover database and report on them seperately.

If it is already supported, via bamboo or maven2, then perhaps documentation could show how to support this.
fields.summary: Clover Code Coverage should support multi module maven builds

fields.description:
We should allow labelling and commenting of test cases, at both a per-build and per-plan level.

This would be particularly useful for making and sharing notes on test cases that are failing intermittently (at a per-plan level), or sharing notes on who is investigating a particular failure (at a per-build level).
fields.summary: Extend label and comment features to test cases

fields.description:
Guys,

Crowd's next release relies on a few methods only available in the latest release of Seraph, it would be great if Bamboo could upgrade to that latest version of Seraph for the next point release to avoid us having to move Seraph code into Crowd.

I have tested the latest Seraph release with trunk of Bamboo (1.3) without issue, so hopefully doing this on branch + trunk should not raise any issues.

Cheers,
Justin

fields.description:
Since Bamboo 1.2 with the SVNKit upgrade the myDate field in the ChangeLogEntry has been invalid

{code:xml}
      <myDate class="org.tmatesoft.svn.core.internal.util.SVNDate">
        <myMicroSeconds>919</myMicroSeconds>
      </myDate>
{code}

Since the field isn't actually shown, this hasn't caused a problem until now. With the xStream upgarde the field now get persisted "properly" as:

{code:xml}
      <myDate class="org.tmatesoft.svn.core.internal.util.SVNDate" serialization="custom">
        <date>
          <long>1187682270157</long>
        </date>
        <org.tmatesoft.svn.core.internal.util.SVNDate>
          <default>
            <myMicroSeconds>371</myMicroSeconds>
          </default>
        </org.tmatesoft.svn.core.internal.util.SVNDate>
      </myDate>
{code}

We'll most likely need to write an upgrade task that fixes this, but with the refactor, maybe we'll see the back of the ChangeLogEntry object all together.

Symptoms are that the build cannnot load, leading to "Bad Things™"
fields.summary: ChangeLogEntry has invalid myDate field

fields.description:
When plans are triggered in Bamboo, the perforce changes are not being picked up. So the build does't get triggered.

As per BSP-231, the changes were not picked up on customers Bamboo instance when bamboo was running as a servoc, but is being picked up when run in console.

Oddly, on Brydie's Bamboo instance the changes were not picked up, regardless of Bamboo being run as service or console (on a Triggered strategy). 

Need to investigate what's causing this weirdness.
fields.summary: Perforce Changelists not picked up properly when triggered.

fields.description:
Due to limitations of the original ZIP file format, and the TrueZIP library used to generate ZIP files, it is not possible to export a Bamboo instance when the resulting ZIP file, or the original size of any of its components, are larger than 4G.

We should adopt an export file format and that does not have this constraint.  ZIP64? .tar.gz? .tar.bz?

We will need to maintain support for importing ZIP exports produced by older versions of Bamboo.
fields.summary: Cannot create export files larger than 4G

fields.description:
As a consequence of BAM-402, when a user clicks on a build artifact, it will always be downloaded, rather than displayed in the browser.

This is not appropriate for all artifact types.

We should set the Content-Disposition header to "inline" for text, image, audio & video Content-Types, so that they are displayed in the browser, when possible.
fields.summary: Implement rules to determine whether an artifact is to be downloaded or viewed in the browser

fields.description: A fairly common test step for automated builds is the execution of a fitnesse or fit test suite.  Fit/fitnesse produces output in raw, html, and xml formats.  Currently the only option to display those results within bamboo is to treat the produced output file as an artifact.  It would be nice if bamboo could parse fitnesse test results and display them in a separate section of the tests tab (not mixed in with junit test results).
fields.summary: Display Fitnesse test results in test tab

fields.description:
There are some kinds of artifacts that users would like to open immediately (e.g. log files) and others that they would like to download (e.g. jar files).

Bamboo 1.2.2 lets the browser decide on the appropriate action based on the Content-Type.  Bamboo determines the Content-Type based on the file extension, and defaults to text/html if the file extension is unrecognised.

As a consequence of BAM-402, Bamboo 1.2.3 will force the browser to download the file.  This is a change in behaviour, and may not be what the user requires.

We should let the user decide by removing the hyperlink from artifact names, and instead offering "view" and "download" links next to each artifact name.  We should use the [Content-Disposition header|http://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc2183] to control this.
fields.summary: Let the user decide whether they want to view or download an artifact

fields.description:
Hi Rosie,

Bamboo 1.2.3 will need a small documentation update for the following improvement:

Bamboo derives the names of test cases from the names of the methods that implement the test cases.

For example, by convention, JUnit test cases usually have names prefixed with the word "test", with the remainder of the name in "camel case" e.g., "testUserCanBeDeleted".  Bamboo removes the "test" prefix (if it exists) and forms a sentence from the rest of the name, using captials to identify the beginning of words.  The previous example becomes "User can be deleted".

Non-Java users (Ruby on Rails developers using Test::Unit, in particular) use different conventions for naming tests.  The convention with Test::Unit is to use underscores to separate words, so the equivalent of the JUnit example above would be "test_user_can_be_deleted".

Bamboo 1.2.3 will treat both capitals and underscores as word separators, so each of the following method names would result in a test case name of "User can be deleted": 

* testUserCanBeDeleted
* test_user_can_be_deleted
* testuserCan_be_Deleted
* userCan_BeDeleted

Please see BAM-1439 or me if you need further details.

Cheers,
Adrian
fields.summary: Update documentation with new test name parsing behaviour

fields.summary: Bamboo will not export under JDK 1.4 using JBoss 4.0.5

fields.description:
we would like to set up our plans that they automatically start whenever changes occur (e.g. repository polling mode), but at least once a day.

Is there an easy way doing this? Well, we could however duplicate each plan, but that wouldn't be a favorite for us...


From, http://forums.atlassian.com/thread.jspa?messageID=257252870#257252870
fields.summary: Ability to configure builds on multiple building strategies.

fields.description:
User defined artifacts may not be suitable for viewing and download by anonymous users.  We would like the option to not allow anonymous access to the user defined artifacts.  Anonymous users would then just be able to view Bamboo changes, build telemetry and logs.   Thank You!

Cheers
-D
fields.summary: Option to deny anonymous access to user defined artifacts

fields.description:
I was adding more than a few (10) built artifacts to a build and I get a null pointer exception. Note that when I go back to the build plan the artifact I was adding is in fact there so it seems to happen after the new artifact has been committed to the database. Here is the output of the error screen. Also find the pertinent part of our log attached. Note that after looking at the log it's clear there is a database problem, but I haven't a clue what "value too long for type character varying" means.:

fields.summary: NullPointerException when adding many artifacts

fields.description:
We are making heavy usage of Bamboo and our build server is often very busy, making the response times of the gui very slow (sometimes timeout)
It would be nice to be able to setup the gui on a different server
fields.summary: Split the CI engine and the user interface into different webapps

fields.description:
AAs a software development company with many many projects for different clients, the Dashboard becomes very crowded. It would be nice if some kind of categories could be created to keep the dasboard slim. 

In other words we need an extra level: Build Plans -> Projects -> Categories?
fields.summary: Project categories

fields.description:
I see in bamboo.log, the following:
2007-08-22 16:29:56,596 INFO [main] [AccessLogFilter] AccessLogFilter initialized. Format is: <user> <url> <starting memory fr
ee (kb)> +- <difference in free mem (kb)> <query time (ms)>


but later when I login or start a manual build, I do not see any log lines with AccessLogFilter.

It seems like I am losing all the AccessLogFilter log lines after the initialization.

Can somebody help me?
fields.summary: AccessLogFilter is configured but does not show <user> <url> <starting memory free in bamboo.log

fields.description: It would be good to be able to use global variables in fields such as JDKs and Builders
fields.summary: Ability to use Bamboo Global Variables within administration fields

fields.description:
It would be nice to be able to use bamboo variables within other variables for example:
my.home           /home/myhome 
my.tools             ${my.home}/mytools
fields.summary: Ability to reference Bamboo Global Variables within other global vairables

fields.description:
Often, users forget having to click on save link to save a new artifact before navigating away from the page. 

Users should be shown a warning dialog box, to inform them that the unsaved data will be lost if they do not save.
fields.summary: Show warning dialong, if users forget to save newly created artifacts, on the build artifacts page before navigating away from the page

fields.description:
Warn users of export limitations


_Originally a support issue BSP-219_
fields.summary: Warn users when an exported file is over 4GB

fields.description:
f no bamboo builds refer to the jira issue, then jira provides a wrong link (see PRC-1) below

---


  *PRC-1: Builds Results*

The table below shows all the builds which is related to JIRA issue: PRC-1
    
<http://joliet:8085http:/www.anim.dreamworks.com/jira/browse/PRC-1>.
  
There are no builds to display for the current search.
fields.summary: Incorrect link generated by JIRA (Bamboo Integration) Portlet

fields.description: When an IO exception occurs and gets propagated up the chain with "Too many files open" or "Disk out of space" there should be an admin message in the UI telling them how they may fix this issue and the possible consequences.
fields.summary: Feedback as an admin message upon catastrophic IO exceptions

fields.description:
Do we need to add a note to the 'Requirements' page about Java 1.5 with Linux?
http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/BAMBOO/Bamboo+Installation+Guide

...or maybe mention on the Linux page instead?
http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/BAMBOO/Bamboo+Standalone+Installation+Guide+%28Linux%29

NB. comment on this page: 
http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/BAMBOO/Bamboo+Standalone+Installation+Guide+%28Linux%29
 'According to Atlassian support (Ajay Sridhar) ticket BSP-218, if you are using Java 1.5 with Linux, you may get FreeMarker template errors until you install java-1.5.0-sun-fonts and restart Bamboo.'

Also see: 
https://support.atlassian.com/browse/BSP-218
fields.summary: Add a note to the 'Requirements' page about Java 1.5 with Linux?

fields.description: According to Ajay Sridhar in [https://support.atlassian.com/browse/BSP-218], the reason why we were getting FreeMarker template errors is because we didn't have java-1.5.0-sun-fonts installed. We installed these, restarted Bamboo, and all seems fine. However, this info wasn't included in the installation documentation (I added a comment to indicate it may be necessary to get rid of those errors) and most webapps don't require this additional font library to be installed in order to run properly. It seems that you may want to consider dropping the requirement for these fonts to get wider adoption.
fields.summary: Drop prerequisite of java-1.5.0-sun-fonts?

fields.description:
For reasons still unknown, Bamboo fragments the indexes in ../<Bamboo-Home>/index/

As a result of which, the ulimit on number of files open is reached on the Bamboo machine. 
{code}
java.io.IOException: Too many open files
	at java.io.UnixFileSystem.createFileExclusively(Native Method)
{code} 

Reported in [BSP-217|https://support.atlassian.com/browse/BSP-217]
fields.summary: FileNotFoundException due to Bamboo fragmenting indexes in ../<Bamboo-Home>/index

fields.summary: Memory issues with Bamboo 1.2.2

fields.description: We were having trouble with bamboo so we shut it down.  Upon restart we get errors (see attached log file).  We did not change _any_ settings, so I'm guessing the database or some xml file was corrupted.  This is a critical blocker for us as we are in the midst of a release and rely heavily on bamboo.  I'm going to try to upgrade us to 1.2.2 to see if this fixes the problem, but I'm at a loss otherwise.
fields.summary: Bamboo will not start anymore...

fields.description:
As above, The "Trigger IP address:" field is not saved when creating/editing plans with perforce repositories.

Originally a support issue [BSP-220|https://support.atlassian.com/browse/BSP-220]
fields.summary: When configuring Perforce scm, with Triggered build. The "Trigger IP address" field doesnot get saved.

fields.description:
Currently you can have links such as:

/bamboo/browse/BAM-MAIN/latest

It would be good if you could have further url parsing to allow:

/bamboo/browse/BAM-MAIN/latest/commit
fields.summary: Improve url 'latest' capabilities

fields.description:
It would be really helpful if the Build Log could have hyperlinks through to FishEye.

So that messages such as:

[java] BUILD FAILED
[java] /home/​bamboo/​xml-data/​build-dir/​FE-DEF/​etc/​apache-forrest-0.5.1-bin/​forrest.build.xml:851: /home/​bamboo/​xml-data/​build-dir/​FE-DEF/​output/​tmp/​doc/​content/​xdocs/​faq.xml is not a valid XML document.

would contain links directly to FishEye for further investigation. 

AFAICT, this information should be available already to Bamboo: FishEye instance location, Relative file paths to the build-dir/FE-DEF .
fields.summary: Hyperlink build log files to FishEye

fields.description:
We currently use atlassian-base 1.5 as the parent of atlassian-bamboo.

It includes some unnecessary dependencies, including junit and jmock in the default scope, rather than the "test" scope.

This is causing these JARs to be packaged in the Agent Bootstrap.

I don't believe that Maven 2 currently provides a way to exclude dependencies specified by a parent POM.

We should upgrade to a newer version.
fields.summary: Move to a newer version of atlassian-base

fields.description:
Currently, web repository URL's are hardcoded in Bamboo to follow fisheye and viewCVS URL format. This limits on how Bamboo can be linked to other web repositories.

In future, it should be possible to configure Bamboo with customizable strings for Web Repository URL's

E.g. http://www.example.com/websvn/listing.php?repname=Kiodex%20SVN&sc=1&rev=${rev}

From [BSP-208|https://support.atlassian.com/browse/BSP-208]
fields.summary: Bamboo should JIRA style linkformat to integrate better with other webrepositories.

fields.description:
Currentlty artifacts link is weird  looking:

Can we make it like all the other links

/bamboo/browse/BAM-MAIN-2624/artifacts

It should also support WebSVN

fields.description:
We have a situation where we have a lot of different types of projects in a source tree. Some of them I would call 'support' or 'common' projects that a lot of the other sub-projects use. We want all of these support projects to be up to date when a build of a *real* project gets triggered. As we have dozens of these projects, and they are added and taken away constantly, it's impractical to have a P4 sync command that covers all these things and keeps the support projects up to date, while at the same time ignoring all the other 'real' projects we would want to trigger a build. Right now I have a 'p4 sync' command running every five minutes from the top level, but what this means is that I lose the ability to monitor projects under the same tree.

What I would like to do is run a global p4 sync update in, say, //DotNet/main/Source/..., but retain the ability to trigger a build within that tree, say at //DotNet/main/Source/CoolProject/...

As it stands, if the first sync 'build' happens before the trigger for the 'Cool Project' build, the command 'p4 sync //DotNet/main/Source/CoolProject/...' will return 'all files up to date' and no build will happen.

It might be a better, more accurate scheme to use 'p4 changes' instead of 'p4 sync' when triggering builds for Perforce repositories. It's not entirely simple, as each build plan would have to track some kind of counter which would save the results from the previous 'p4 changes' command, but the build triggers would be more explicit and would not rely on a 'p4 sync' command that could conceivably be run by anyone at any time, thus voiding many possible build triggers.

It hasn't come up with us, but I could also see a time when one would want a certain checkin of a common library to trigger multiple builds. We can't do this now because 1) We can't monitor multiple repository paths (different issue) and 2) even if we could do #1 the first plan to sync this particular path would 'win' and no other plans below that would trigger a build.
fields.summary: Perforce repository polling: Use 'changes' instead of 'sync' to detect changes

Hi,

We have several build artifacts which would be nice to have for the latested build, but uninterresting to save for all other historic builds. For artifacts such as codecoverage reports, findbugs/checkstyle/pmd reports we are only interrested in the latest version.

It would therefor be nice for us, if we could configure pr. artifact how long to keep that artifact. A selection between the following options would suite our needs:
o Forever
o Last 10 builds
o Last build only

fields.description:
Our usernames in SVN are closely related to our email addresses (ex SVN: bob --> bob@example.com).
Instead of having to set up users in bamboo for everyone, it would be nice if we could just use a regex string to transform the svn username into an email address.

This would allow for "Commiter" role to work without having to create a bamboo user.

fields.summary: Exports (Scheduled back-ups) do not work when Crowd is integrated with Bamboo.

fields.description:
Instead of creating an index.html file that redirects the user to the latest artifact directory, allow for the option of copying the artifacts to the 'latest' directory.

This will make it easier to access the artifacts from the latest build.  (Instead of having to use the remote API to determine what the latest build number is and infer the path from that)
fields.summary: Copy Artifcats to the 'latest' artifact directory

fields.description: It would be nice if Bamboo would send a notification to the user(s) that triggered the last build upon completion.  I don't see this feature in 1.2.2.
fields.summary: Notification option to send to user that triggered last build

fields.description:

fields.summary: Users containing the character '@' in their User Names, can't create plans

fields.description:
Sorry if you get this twice, I hit preview and then the back button which was a bad idea.

We currently own Confluence and JIRA and love both.  We are investigating Bamboo (we own AHP2 and are also considering AHP3 among others).  Before we make a 10-license Bamboo purchase, there are two features I would like to get status on:

1) Perforce Labeling of build (either at build kick off time, or after successful build is produced).  See Arash's comment on [BAM-620].

2) A more robust versioning option that allows us to choose our own versioning model (i.e.  M.mm.bb) that includes MAJOR, minor, and build numbers.  This is represented in either [BAM-1166] or [BAM-504].

Both are pretty critical to us, and I'd like to know if there are any plans for future implementation or if they're not on any roadmap currently.  There's one more that we need -

3) An option to kick off a clean build at any time. By clean build we mean a completely clean checkout of the source code. We would like to do this regularly just to prevent issues that might arise of improper file syncs.

However I believe we can accomplish that through an Ant task, so we'll disregard that one.  Thanks for your time and attention!

regards,

Stephen Kowalski
Edmunds.com
fields.summary: Questions about 2 features before we purchase Bamboo

fields.description:
Luntbuild had a great notification policy:
a) notify on first failure
b) notify on first success

So our dev team new when the build went from good to bad and vice versa.  I'd really like this ability in Bamboo.  Otherwise when something is broken for a few hours the failures messages get diluted and people start filtering.
fields.summary: Notification Policy: first failure and first success

fields.description:
Currently, the artifact copier plugin in Bamboo doesn't do a recursive copy of subfolders given a target directory. 

It would be useful if entire directory including the child directories could be copied as artifacts in a build

Originally a forum issue http://forums.atlassian.com/thread.jspa?threadID=18944&tstart=0.

{quote}

I've built a mega-project using svn:externals to include several
independent projects. Each project has a 'target' directory that I want
to expose as a Build Artifact. I tried

Label: target
Source Directory: **/target
Copy Pattern: */.*

hoping that the '**/target' would collect them all. It didn't.

Is there a way to do this, or do i need to specify all the
individual <subproject>/target folders as separate artifacts?
{quote}
fields.summary: Artifacts should recursively copy contents of directories, copying over child directories if required.
